Dear Jason Lheureux:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 07/11/2023. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:

(c) Verification of high school diploma or GED when
specified by rule.
One out of eleven new employee files reviewed did not have the documentation
of verification of high school diploma or GED for the staff members specific role.
CCI Rule 400.4113 Employee records.
(1)An institution shall maintain employee records for
each employee and shall include documentation of all
of the following information prior to employment or at
the time specified in this rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior
to employment from persons unrelated to the employee
and which are less than 12 months old.
(i) Directly from the Michigan state police or the
equivalent state law enforcement agency, Canadian
province, or other country where the person usually
resides or has resided in the previous 5 years.
One out of eleven new employee files reviewed did not meet the rule of three
dated references prior to employment from persons unrelated to the employee.
The file noting this rule violation had a reference completed by a family member
due to working for the family member.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Consultant met with human resource department about the violations
pertaining to hiring staff. It was reported by the human resource department it
was found one of the employees was not following through with the checklist
and was then let go from the agency. The human resource department is in the
process of hiring new staff members and plan to have a clear training plan that
goes along with the state licensing rules as it pertains to hiring staff members.
V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• No consultation was requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 2 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The facility had five special investigations during the last reporting period and two
ended in corrective action plans. The facility was found to be in non-compliance of
staff not following the facility’s behavior management policy and facility being out
of staffing ratio. The facility’s correction action plan compliance is monitored
quarterly, and no further issues have been identified.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
Not Applicable
Chief Administrator Assessment
Chief administrator reported since the last reporting period, census and staffing
have stabilized significantly within the program. The Vanderark program BCBA
model has been fully implemented. This program has been able to add in two full-
time non-ratio BCBA staff. With these two staff members the program has been
able to develop more robust response plans to target specific client behaviors such
as self-harm, emotional regulations, negative attention seeking, build relational
skills and increase client competencies in tools of daily living. For the next coming
year, the facility will continue to focus in the areas of sufficiency and training of
staff, safe milieu management with a limited application of physical restraint and
successful client transitions to less restricted care.
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. Staff reported they feel they have the proper training and are well
versed in the youth's treatment needs and plan. Staff reported they feel the team is
well rounded and has positive communication. One staff requested to gain more
knowledge about the administrative team.
Youth interviews were conducted during the inspection and no issues or concerns
were raised. The youth reported they feel safe and have a positive relationship
with the staff. One youth reported they feel very supported by their therapist on the
unit and feels the therapist has helped them make positive changes within their
life.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An on-site inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on July 11, 2023.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.

VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
